--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Matei I. Radulescu" <matei@...>=
 wrote:
>
> When one computes the the free-flame structure (say H2+air at P=
TN),
> the equilibrium temperature obtained is different from the true
> ad=
iabatic flame temperature obtained via a direct equilibrium
> calculation, =
using the same thermo data.  The differences are on the
> order of 10K for =
the example given.  Likewise, the enthalpy in the
> flame of the equilibriu=
m products is NOT found equal to reactants
> enthalpy, although theoretical=
ly, they should be equal.  This leads me
> to suspect that the non-conserva=
tive flame calculations introduces
> order 1 errors in the species concentr=
ations of the products,
> consistent with the results of the simulations!  =
Are these
> *acceptable* errors???
>
